32  class Interpolator {
33  std::vector<Scalar> weights;
34  std::vector<Index> indices;
35 
36  public:
37  Interpolator() {}
38  Interpolator(std::vector<Scalar> &weights, std::vector<Index> &indices)
39  : weights(std::move(weights)), indices(std::move(indices))
40  {
41 #ifndef NDEBUG
42  check();
43 #endif
44  }
45 
46  Scalar operator()(const Scalar *field) const {
47  Scalar ret(0);
48  for (size_t i=0; i<weights.size(); ++i)
49  ret += field[indices[i]] * weights[i];
50  return ret;
51  }
52 
53  Vector3 operator()(const Scalar *f0, const Scalar *f1, const Scalar *f2) const {
54  Vector3 ret(0, 0, 0);
55  for (size_t i=0; i<weights.size(); ++i) {
56  const Index ind(indices[i]);
57  const Scalar w(weights[i]);
58  ret += Vector3(f0[ind], f1[ind], f2[ind]) * w;
59  }
60  return ret;
61  }
62 
63  bool check() const;
64  };
65 
66  DEFINE_ENUM_WITH_STRING_CONVERSIONS(InterpolationMode, (First) // value of first vertex
67  (Mean) // mean value of all vertices
68  (Nearest) // value of nearest vertex
69  (Linear) // barycentric/multilinear interpolation
70  );
71 
72  virtual Interpolator getInterpolator(Index elem, const Vector &point, DataBase::Mapping mapping=DataBase::Vertex, InterpolationMode mode=Linear) const = 0;
73  Interpolator getInterpolator(const Vector &point, DataBase::Mapping mapping=DataBase::Vertex, InterpolationMode mode=Linear) const {
74  const Index elem = findCell(point);
75  if (elem == InvalidIndex) {
76  return Interpolator();
77  }
78  return getInterpolator(elem, point, mapping, mode);
79  }
80 };
81 
82 }
